remarks: The symbol at index 0 of a cyclically shifted nonempty word is the symbol at index N (modulo the length of the word) of the original word. (Contributed by AV, 30-Oct-2018.)
statement: cshwidx0mod $p |- ( ( W e. Word V /\ W =/= (/) /\ N e. ZZ ) -> ( ( W cyclShift N ) ` 0 ) = ( W ` ( N mod ( # ` W ) ) ) ) $.
